item.title: IBM HR Analytics
item.description: knitr::opts_chunk$set( message = FALSE, warning = FALSE, tidy=FALSE, # display code as typed size="small") # slightly I font for code options(digits = 3) # default figure size knitr::opts_chunk$set( fig.width=6.75, fig.height=6.75, fig.align = "center" ) IBM HR Analytics Dataset: An Intro I will analyse a data set on Human Resoruce Analytics. The IBM HR Analytics Employee Attrition & Performance data set is a fictional data set created by IBM data scientists.

item.title: IMDB ratings: Differences between directors
item.description: IMDB Ratings: A primer INSERT some details about the dataset The Data Here is the dataset we will be working with. We can use glimpse to get a brief overview of the data. #contents of the movies dataset glimpse(movies) ## Rows: 2,961 ## Columns: 11 ## $ title <chr> "Avatar", "Titanic", "Jurassic World", "The Ave... ## $ genre <chr> "Action", "Drama", "Action", "Action", "Action"... ## $ director <chr> "James Cameron", "James Cameron", "Colin Trevor.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
